sql-case.value: SELECT SUM(order_id) AS orders_sum, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY user_id
SELECT p.prod_subcategory, SUM(s.amount_sold) AS sum_amount FROM sales s, products p WHERE s.prod_id = p.prod_id GROUP BY p.prod_subcategory
SELECT COUNT(order_id) AS orders_count, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY user_id
SELECT MAX(order_id) AS max_order_id, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY user_id
SELECT MIN(order_id) AS min_order_id, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY user_id
SELECT AVG(order_id) AS orders_avg, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY user_id
SELECT p.prod_subcategory, AVG(s.amount_sold) AS avg_sales FROM sales s, products p WHERE s.prod_id = p.prod_id GROUP BY p.prod_subcategory
SELECT SUM(order_id) AS orders_sum, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY orders_sum DESC
SELECT count(*) AS items_count FROM t_order o JOIN t_order_item i ON o.user_id = i.user_id AND o.order_id = i.order_id WHERE o.user_id IN (?, ?) AND o.order_id BETWEEN ? AND ? GROUP BY o.user_id
SELECT user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY user_id LIMIT ?
SELECT user_id, SUM(order_id) AS orders_sum FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY SUM(order_id) LIMIT ?
SELECT o.user_id uid FROM t_order o GROUP BY o.user_id ORDER BY o.user_id
SELECT date_format(creation_date, '%y-%m-%d') as creation_date, count(*) as c_number FROM `t_order_item` WHERE order_id in (?, ?) GROUP BY date_format(creation_date, '%y-%m-%d')
SELECT SUM(order_id) AS orders_sum, user_id as `key` FROM t_order GROUP BY `key`
SELECT COUNT(order_id) AS orders_count, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY 2 ORDER BY 2
SELECT COUNT(order_id) AS orders_count, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id HAVING orders_count > 0
SELECT COUNT(order_id), user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id HAVING COUNT(order_id) > 0
SELECT COUNT(order_id) AS orders_count, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id HAVING orders_count > 0 WINDOW w AS (PARTITION BY user_id)

SELECT DECODE(GROUPING(department_name), 1, 'All Departments', department_name) AS department_name, DECODE(GROUPING(job_id), 1, 'All Jobs', job_id) AS job_id, COUNT(*) "Total Empl", AVG(salary) * 12 "Average Sal" FROM employees e, departments d WHERE d.department_id = e.department_id GROUP BY CUBE (department_name, job_id) ORDER BY department_name, job_id

SELECT channel_desc, calendar_month_desc, co.country_id, TO_CHAR(SUM(amount_sold) , '9,999,999,999') SALES$ FROM sales, customers, times, channels, countries co WHERE sales.time_id=times.time_id GROUP BY GROUPING SETS((channel_desc,calendar_month_desc,co.country_id), (channel_desc,co.country_id), (calendar_month_desc,co.country_id))
SELECT department_id, MIN(salary), MAX(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY department_id HAVING MIN(salary) < 5000 ORDER BY department_id

SELECT department_id, manager_id FROM employees GROUP BY department_id, manager_id HAVING (department_id, manager_id) IN (SELECT department_id, manager_id FROM employees x WHERE x.department_id = employees.department_id) ORDER BY department_id

SELECT order_id FROM t_order GROUP BY CASE WHEN order_id > 0 AND order_id <= 10 THEN '(0,10]' WHEN order_id > 10 THEN '(10,+∞)' ELSE '' END ORDER BY CASE WHEN order_id > 0 AND order_id <= 10 THEN '(0,10]' WHEN order_id > 10 THEN '(10,+∞)' ELSE '' END

SELECT c.name, Count(*) AS [Count-Per-Column-Repeated-Name] FROM sys.syscolumns AS c JOIN sys.sysobjects AS o ON o.id = c.id WHERE o.type = 'V' AND c.name like '%event%' GROUP BY c.name HAVING Count(*) >= 3 ORDER BY c.name
SELECT DATEPART(yyyy,OrderDate) AS N'Year', SUM(TotalDue) AS N'Total Order Amount' FROM Sales.SalesOrderHeader GROUP BY DATEPART(yyyy,OrderDate) ORDER BY DATEPART(yyyy,OrderDate)

SELECT DATEPART(yyyy,OrderDate) AS N'Year', SUM(TotalDue) AS N'Total Order Amount' FROM Sales.SalesOrderHeader GROUP BY DATEPART(yyyy,OrderDate) HAVING DATEPART(yyyy,OrderDate) >= N'2003' ORDER BY DATEPART(yyyy,OrderDate)
SELECT count(*) FROM input GROUP BY PartitionId, clusterid, tumblingwindow;
SELECT TOP 10 hash_unique_bigint_id FROM dbo.TelemetryDS WHERE Timestamp BETWEEN @StartTime AND @EndTime GROUP BY hash_unique_bigint_id ORDER BY MAX(max_elapsed_time_microsec) DESC
SELECT count(*) FROM input GROUP BY clusterid,tumblingwindow(minutes, 5)
